definition: to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: There are so many leapers in this league, so many basket attackers.
sentences.chinese: 聯盟裏現在有如此多的彈跳人和灌籃家。

sentences.english: From side to side BOOBIES of Stephanie Carpenter are bouncing.
sentences.chinese: 從一邊到另一邊的斯蒂芬妮匠鰹鳥是彈跳。

sentences.english: Bending knees and bouncing in the modern dance hangover stretch increases the warm-up.
sentences.chinese: 彎曲的膝蓋和在現代舞蹈解酒伸展彈跳增加熱身。

sentences.english: Jumping power is a main factor when predicting the potential achievement of a young basketball player.
sentences.chinese: 彈跳力是預測一名年輕籃球運動員潛質的主要因素。

sentences.english: The original Bionic Boots were basically strap-on animal legs for people.
sentences.chinese: 最初的仿生彈跳器只是給人綁上動物的腿。

sentences.english: He had learned how to bounce off a seaweed pod.
sentences.chinese: 他已經學會了彈跳過海藻羣。

sentences.english: The cannon vomited forth its package of buck -shot with a roar. But there was no rebound.
sentences.chinese: 大炮一聲吼，噴出了一叢霰彈，但沒有彈跳的情況。

sentences.english: The cannon vomited forth its package of buck-shot with a roar. But there was no rebound.
sentences.chinese: 大炮一聲吼，噴出了一叢霰彈，但沒有彈跳的情況。

sentences.english: Push down stretches start by pushing down towards the floor and bouncing back up.
sentences.chinese: 向下延伸開始推推下來，對地板和彈跳備份。

sentences.english: Free-running involves a lot of trick moves, particularly mid-air flips and spins.
sentences.chinese: 自由奔跑包括許多技巧動作，尤其是半空彈跳與旋轉。

sentences.english: The figure in the jack-in-the-box sprang up when the boy opened the lid.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩揭開玩偶匣蓋時，裏面的玩偶即彈跳起來。

sentences.english: Behind a silver horse the blood corpse of a naked man bounced and dragged.
sentences.chinese: 銀馬拖着一具血淋淋的赤裸男屍，在崎嶇的地面彈跳。

sentences.english: What is the Dead-Cat Bounce Pattern Saying about the Short-term Price for Silver?
sentences.chinese: 什麼是死貓彈跳模式大約爲銀短期價格在說什麼？

sentences.english: For example if a rubber ball bounces and hits the ground it will tend to flatten when it hits.
sentences.chinese: 比如一個橡皮球彈跳後落到地面時身體會被壓扁。

sentences.english: They spin and they tumble. They bounce on the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 它們轉圈，翻跟頭，在微風中彈跳。

definition: to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
to roll over/to turn over (one's body)

(martial arts) wind-and-fire wheel, weapon used in hand-to-hand fighting/(Daoism) a magical pair of wheels on which one can stand to ride at great speed, used by Nezha 哪吒[Ne2 zha5]/(fig.) never-ending treadmill
to soar/to rise high into the air
also written 機槍|机枪/machine gun
